headline: Tariff Deadline Nears‚Äî Will it Renew Trade Tensions or be the Catalyst for Crypto Bull Run?
summary: The post Tariff Deadline Nears‚Äî Will it Renew Trade Tensions or be the Catalyst for Crypto Bull Run? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The financial world is bracing for a pivotal moment on July 09, 2025, when the US‚Äôs temporary suspension of its new tariff regime expires. Initially dubbed ‚ÄòLiberation Day‚Äô tariffs, announced by President Donald Trump, carry implications far beyond traditional trade routes. Soon after the announcement, the crypto markets and the traditional markets were disrupted, causing a major drop. Now that the deadline is approaching, the question arises whether this deadline will reignite a global tariff war or it could unexpectedly serve as a bullish catalyst for the crypto market and Bitcoin price . Understanding the July 09 Deadline The July 09 deadline marks the end of a 90-day suspension on sweeping tariffs proposed by the US earlier in 2025. These tariffs were designed to punish countries with persistent trade imbalances or those seen as having unfair trade practices. The US government offered temporary relief in April, giving trade partners time to negotiate deals or face new levies. If the agreement is not reached by the deadline, the full weight of tariffs could take effect by early August, sparking fears of renewed global trade conflict. Market Sentiment: Calm Before the Storm? Interestingly, traditional markets have remained relatively stable in the lead-up to the July 09 deadline. The S&P 500 and NASDAQ have both shown resilience, while the U.S.Dollar Index (DXY) has slipped over 6% since April, which is believed to be the worst start to a year since 1973. Some analysts believe much of the tariff uncertainty is already priced into equities, though volatility is expected to spike if no trade resolutions are announced. Moreover, the safe-haven asset, Gold, has seen a rise in inflows, indicating that investors are preparing for a potential geopolitical fallout. Crypto Markets Reacting Ahead of Time Unlike traditional markets, the crypto markets appear to be thriving in this ocean of uncertainty. Bitcoin price has surged past $108,500, while Ethereum & other altcoins have posted significant gains. Several factors contribute to this bullish sentiment, including a weaker USD, decentralised hedge and rising market confidence. Therefore, the crypto markets are expected to face a short-term pullback if tensions escalate or if the countries reach out to make a deal, then the Bitcoin price is expected to experience a significant bullish push. Scenario Analysis: Three Possible Outcomes Firstly, if the US resumes tariffs without any new deals, global trade could deteriorate rapidly, stocks may plunge, inflation could spike, and crypto may initially fall in a risk-off panic. Besides, if the deadline is extended, which is expected to be more likely, risk appetite could return across all sectors. Stocks & crypto may rise if traders see this as a sign of market-friendly policy. On the other hand, if a comprehensive resolution is reached, it could lead to bullish sentiment across global markets. This may even cause a breakout, propelling the Bitcoin price towards new highs. Wrapping it Up! The July 09 tariff deadline is more than just a bureaucratic market, representing a turning point for the global economy and the evolving crypto ecosystem. Whether it triggers a new trade war or serves as a launchpad for crypto depends entirely on how global leaders navigate these final hours.

headline: Trouble may be on the horizon as Bitcoin mempool runs close to historical lows
summary: The Bitcoin blockchain is showing signs of declining user activity, despite the coin trading close to all-time highs. Bitcoin is changing hands slightly under $109,000, 2.7% less than its all-time high value, on an uptick of 7% from its 14-day lows, per Coingecko data. On Saturday, only around 5,000 transactions were waiting in the Bitcoin mempool, the virtual queue where unconfirmed transactions are held before being added to the blockchain by miners. At press time, the number had risen to 15,000, still a fraction of the 150,000 seen in late 2024 when BTC first crossed the $100,000 mark, according to Blockchain.com. Market fears low activity could become a permanent issue Last Saturday, podcaster and Bitcoin advocate Joel Valanzuela shared his sentiment on X that the drop in transactions signals a profound issue with actual network utility. ‚Äú Simply put, almost all of Bitcoin‚Äôs actual users have gone away. At all-time price highs, too ,‚Äù Valanzuela wrote. ‚Äú We‚Äôre facing a major crisis. Either the Bitcoin network goes bankrupt, undergoes major changes, or the asset becomes a completely custodial asset run by governments and institutions. ‚Äù Since March, mempool transaction counts have fluctuated between 3,000 and 30,000. Like Valanzuela, the community is concerned because the low figures are persistent, even though the asset has been trading above six figures in value for several months. Bitcoin's mempool (queue of transactions waiting to be processed) is almost completely empty. The percentage of miner revenue coming from fees (instead of inflation) is down to a fraction of a percent. üò± Simply put, almost all of Bitcoin's actual users have gone away. At‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/Kbk3j1e8c1 ‚Äî Joel Valenzuela (@TheDesertLynx) July 5, 2025 Joao Wedson, CEO of crypto analytics platform Alphractal, believes the low mempool numbers are due to a lack of retail participation. ‚Äú When mempool transactions begin to rise again, it‚Äôs a clear sign that retail is back, because the growing backlog reflects increased demand for using the network ,‚Äù Wedson asserted. Institutional inflow is not filling the gap In its report published on July 3, Blockchain analytics firm CryptoQuant found that spot demand for Bitcoin was weakening, even though large institutions continue to acquire BTC through ETFs and treasury allocations. The report mentioned that net Bitcoin demand contracted by roughly 895,000 BTC over the past 30 days, suggesting that buying from ETFs and companies like Strategy (MicroStrategy) is insufficient to offset declines. Data on the analysis shows that ETF purchases over a 30-day period have dropped from 86,000 BTC on December 7, 2024, to 71,000 BTC by May 18, 2025, and further down to 40,000 BTC currently, a 53% decline. Strategy‚Äôs buying spree also fell to 16,000 BTC in the past 30 days, a downtick of 90% from its peak of 171,000 BTC in December. CryptoQuant‚Äôs Bitcoin Traders‚Äô Behavior Dominance metric shows most market participants took profits after BTC reached $110,000 in late June. After the coin saw a pullback to $107,500, traders reportedly opened new short positions as BTC fell below $105,000, backing their bearish belief in the geopolitical differences between Israel and Iran. ‚ÄúETFs and MSTR purchases are a portion of bitcoin demand, overall demand contraction is more than offsetting these purchases,‚Äù the analysis read. ‚ÄúThe acceleration of overall demand growth is what drives price rallies.‚Äù The slowdown could mean institutional demand may no longer be enough to support the current price levels. Large-scale buyers may be reassessing their accumulation strategies. headline: Institutional Bitcoin Buying Loses Steam as Political Support Rises
summary: Bitcoin is holding steady near $109,000 but is facing signs of weakening demand, with institutional purchases by firms like Strategy and ETF inflows slowing significantly in recent weeks. At the same time, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has launched the America Party, a new political initiative that openly supports Bitcoin. While Musk‚Äôs backing gives the cryptocurrency fresh political visibility, analysts note that declining spot demand and limited retail participation continue to weigh on price performance. Bitcoin Hovers at $109K as Demand Weakens Despite Institutional Interest Bitcoin (BTC) is trading at approximately $109,451, marking a 0.8% rise over the past week and a 4.5% gain over the last month.. Yet, even with steady institutional interest and a favorable macro backdrop, the world‚Äôs largest digital asset remains stuck in a consolidation range, leaving many market watchers questioning what it will take to reignite a meaningful rally. Institutional Support Can't Offset Shrinking Spot Demand Despite prominent institutional moves ‚Äî including Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy (MSTR) continuing to accumulate BTC, and sustained inflows into Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) ‚Äî a new report from CryptoQuant reveals a stark disconnect between institutional buying and overall market demand. ‚ÄúETFs and MSTR purchases are a portion of bitcoin demand, but overall demand contraction is more than offsetting these purchases,‚Äù CryptoQuant noted. ‚ÄúThe acceleration of overall demand growth is what drives price rallies.‚Äù The data is sobering. Over the past 30 days alone, demand for BTC has contracted by approximately 895,000 coins. That drop dwarfs the combined impact of institutional purchases, which have slowed significantly compared to their December highs. At the end of last year, ETFs absorbed 86,000 BTC and MSTR bought 171,000. In stark contrast, ETFs purchased just 40,000 BTC last month, while MSTR‚Äôs acquisitions fell to a mere 16,000 BTC. Perhaps even more telling than institutional flows is the state of Bitcoin‚Äôs mempool ‚Äî the waiting room for unconfirmed transactions. At present, the mempool is nearly empty, a strong indicator that retail spot demand is drying up. This suggests that price action is being driven almost entirely by institutions, and with even those flows declining, the upward momentum for BTC appears increasingly unsustainable without fresh demand catalysts. Treasury Strategy Losing Its Shine? The Bitcoin treasury strategy, once a trending narrative with companies emulating Strategy‚Äôs aggressive approach, is also coming under scrutiny. Speaking to Bloomberg, SkyBridge Capital founder Anthony Scaramucci warned that the replicative BTC-on-the-balance-sheet model is likely to fade. ‚ÄúRight now we‚Äôre having this replicative treasury company idea,‚Äù said Scaramucci. ‚ÄúSo, you know, it will fade.‚Äù He clarified that Saylor‚Äôs case is unique due to the diversified nature of Strategy‚Äôs Bitcoin-linked financial products. However, for newer entrants trying to follow the same playbook, the outlook may not be as promising. ‚ÄúYou have to look through the underlying costs associated with each one of these treasury companies,‚Äù Scaramucci added, urging caution despite his bullishness on Bitcoin overall. Amid the subdued sentiment, Standard Chartered remains one of the few steadfast bulls in the room. The British multinational bank continues to project a $200,000 BTC price target, expressing confidence that the long-term fundamentals of the cryptocurrency remain intact despite current headwinds. This forecast hinges on a belief that regulatory clarity, institutional adoption, and macroeconomic shifts ‚Äî including a weakening dollar and growing de-dollarization ‚Äî will eventually act as tailwinds for Bitcoin‚Äôs price. Looking Ahead: A Breakout or Breakdown? For now, however, Bitcoin is locked in a prolonged consolidation phase with no immediate catalyst in sight. The market appears to be in a holding pattern, waiting either for renewed retail enthusiasm or for a significant macro or technological event that could breathe life back into demand. If institutional purchases continue to slow, and retail remains largely absent, Bitcoin may struggle to maintain its current price level, let alone break past its all-time highs. Still, with the next Bitcoin halving less than a year away and global capital markets watching crypto more closely than ever, many believe that BTC‚Äôs quiet phase could be the calm before the next major storm. Elon Musk Forms ‚ÄúAmerica Party‚Äù to Challenge US Political Duopoly ‚Äî Confirms Support for Bitcoin Musk‚Äôs announcement came just days after a high-profile public feud with former ally Donald Trump over the recently passed $3.4 trillion ‚Äú Big, Beautiful Bill ‚Äù ‚Äî a sweeping spending package Musk called a ‚Äúdisgusting abomination‚Äù for its impact on the federal deficit. Now, with the launch of the America Party, the SpaceX and Tesla CEO is calling for a reset of both the political and monetary systems ‚Äî and Bitcoin is firmly in his vision for the future. ‚ÄúFiat Is Hopeless‚Äù: Musk Pledges Support for Bitcoin The Tesla CEO confirmed the America Party‚Äôs pro-Bitcoin stance on Sunday in a reply to a user on X (formerly Twitter) who asked if his new political party would support the digital currency. ‚ÄúFiat is hopeless, so yes,‚Äù Musk replied ‚Äî a statement that reverberated through both political and crypto circles alike. The comment adds another layer to Musk‚Äôs long-running relationship with cryptocurrencies, which has included Tesla‚Äôs brief acceptance of Bitcoin for payments and Musk‚Äôs public support of Dogecoin. Now, it appears Bitcoin could be a core part of his vision for a new American political and financial future. In his Saturday announcement, Musk said the America Party was born from frustration with a political establishment he believes has become indistinguishable, especially when it comes to reckless spending. ‚ÄúWhen it comes to bankrupting our country with waste & graft, we live in a one-party system, not a democracy,‚Äù Musk wrote on X. ‚ÄúToday, the America Party is formed to give you back your freedom.‚Äù According to Musk, the America Party‚Äôs strategy could involve targeting just two or three key Senate seats and up to ten House districts. That, he argues, would be enough to sway tight votes and force both parties to legislate in line with the public‚Äôs interests ‚Äî especially given the razor-thin margins in Congress. Rift With Trump and Growing Political Fault Lines The America Party‚Äôs launch comes just a week after Trump signed the controversial ‚ÄúBig, Beautiful Bill‚Äù into law ‚Äî a move Musk vocally opposed. The bill‚Äôs $3.4 trillion spending plan sparked fury from fiscal conservatives and libertarians, many of whom saw Musk‚Äôs criticism as a call to action. Trump, for his part, dismissed Musk‚Äôs movement as a fantasy. ‚ÄúMusk has gone completely off the rails,‚Äù Trump posted on Truth Social. ‚ÄúA third party has never succeeded in the history of the US‚Äù But Musk is betting that history can change. Bitcoin as a Political Symbol By backing Bitcoin, Musk is not just endorsing a currency ‚Äî he‚Äôs signaling a rebellion against the traditional monetary system, which he argues is corrupted by inflation and centralized control. This move could attract a new class of crypto-native voters ‚Äî especially younger Americans disillusioned by the status quo. With blockchain and financial sovereignty becoming increasingly politicized, the America Party could turn Bitcoin into a cornerstone of its identity ‚Äî much like environmental issues were once adopted by the Green Party. Despite the buzz, political analysts remain skeptical of the America Party‚Äôs viability. Third-party efforts in the US have historically failed due to institutional roadblocks, voter polarization, and the winner-takes-all electoral system. Yet Musk‚Äôs reach is undeniably vast. With over 180 million followers on X and a loyal fanbase spanning tech, finance, and crypto, even a fringe third-party campaign could shape national conversations ‚Äî particularly in battleground states where margins are slim. With a core message of fiscal responsibility, decentralization, and freedom ‚Äî underpinned by support for Bitcoin ‚Äî Musk is planting a flag for a new kind of political and monetary future. headline: Russia Unveils Landmark Crypto Mining Registry: Boosting Tax Revenue and Control
summary: BitcoinWorld Russia Unveils Landmark Crypto Mining Registry: Boosting Tax Revenue and Control The world of cryptocurrency is constantly evolving, and with its rapid growth comes the inevitable push for greater regulation. Recently, a significant development emerged from Russia that could redefine the landscape for digital asset miners globally. The Russian Energy Ministry is reportedly taking a bold step by creating a national database of crypto mining equipment. This move isn‚Äôt just about tracking hardware; it‚Äôs a strategic initiative designed to tackle unauthorized activities and, crucially, to significantly increase the nation‚Äôs tax revenue from the burgeoning crypto sector. For anyone involved in Crypto Mining Russia , this is a development that demands close attention. What is the Russian Crypto Regulation Initiative All About? At its core, this new initiative by the Russian Energy Ministry aims to bring transparency and accountability to the country‚Äôs crypto mining industry. For years, crypto mining has operated in a somewhat gray area, with varying degrees of official recognition and oversight. This new registry seeks to formalize the industry by creating a comprehensive national database that will track every piece of mining hardware used across the country. Think of it as a centralized inventory system for all mining rigs, from small-scale home operations to large industrial farms. Centralized Data: The registry will collect data on the type, location, and operational status of mining equipment. Official Recognition: It signals a shift towards acknowledging crypto mining as a legitimate, albeit regulated, economic activity. Inter-agency Collaboration: This isn‚Äôt just an Energy Ministry project; it‚Äôs expected to involve collaboration with tax authorities, law enforcement, and other relevant government bodies. Long-term Vision: This move is part of a broader trend of countries seeking to integrate digital assets into their existing financial and regulatory frameworks. Why a National Mining Registry ? The Goals Behind Russia‚Äôs Move The decision to establish a national registry isn‚Äôt arbitrary. It‚Äôs driven by several key objectives that address both economic and regulatory challenges. Russia, with its abundant and relatively cheap energy resources, has become a significant hub for crypto mining. However, this growth has also presented challenges related to energy consumption, environmental impact, and illicit activities. The primary goals of implementing a National Mining Registry include: Goal Description Expected Outcome Curbing Unauthorized Activities Identifying and penalizing illegal mining operations that bypass regulations, steal electricity, or are used for illicit purposes. Reduced energy theft, improved grid stability, decreased criminal activity related to crypto. Increasing Tax Revenue Bringing mining operations into the formal economy, ensuring they contribute taxes on their profits. Significant boost to state coffers, funding for public services. Energy Grid Management Monitoring and managing the substantial energy consumption of mining farms to prevent overloads and ensure stable power supply. More efficient energy distribution, fewer power outages caused by unregulated mining. Economic Development Creating a stable and predictable environment for legitimate mining businesses, encouraging investment and job creation. Attraction of foreign investment, growth of local tech industries. Boosting Crypto Tax Revenue : A Key Driver One of the most compelling reasons for Russia to implement this registry is the immense potential for increased Crypto Tax Revenue . As the value of cryptocurrencies has soared, so too have the profits generated by mining operations. However, without a clear mechanism to track and tax these activities, a significant portion of this potential revenue has remained untapped. The registry provides the necessary framework for tax authorities to identify miners, assess their operations, and ensure compliance with tax laws. This could involve various forms of taxation: Income Tax: On the profits generated from selling mined cryptocurrencies. Energy Tariffs: Potentially differentiated electricity tariffs for mining operations, or taxes on energy consumption. Equipment Import Duties: Taxes on the import of specialized mining hardware. By bringing these operations into the light, Russia aims to create a new, substantial income stream for the state budget, mirroring efforts seen in other nations exploring digital asset taxation. The Challenge of Unauthorized Crypto Mining in Russia The existence of a significant volume of Unauthorized Crypto Mining has been a persistent headache for Russian authorities. These operations often tap into the national grid illegally, leading to energy theft, power fluctuations, and even blackouts in certain regions. Furthermore, unregistered mining activities make it difficult for law enforcement to track potential illicit uses of cryptocurrencies, such as money laundering or funding illegal activities. The registry is envisioned as a powerful tool to combat these issues. By requiring all equipment to be registered, authorities can: Identify Illegal Connections: Cross-reference registered equipment with energy consumption data to spot anomalies. Track Malicious Actors: Link unregistered equipment to individuals or organizations engaged in illegal activities. Enhance National Security: Gain better oversight over a sector that could potentially be exploited by bad actors. This crackdown is not just about revenue; it‚Äôs about establishing state control and ensuring the integrity of critical infrastructure. Impact on Crypto Mining Russia : What Miners Need to Know For miners operating in Russia, this new registry will undoubtedly bring significant changes. While it introduces new compliance requirements, it also offers a pathway to legitimacy and potentially a more stable operating environment. Miners will need to: Register Their Equipment: This is the fundamental requirement, ensuring their operations are officially recognized. Comply with Tax Laws: Prepare to pay taxes on their mining profits, potentially requiring detailed record-keeping. Adhere to Energy Regulations: Ensure their power consumption is within legal limits and they are paying appropriate tariffs. Potentially Benefit from Stability: Legitimate miners might see reduced risks from raids or sudden operational shutdowns, as they will be operating within a recognized framework. The transition may be challenging for some, especially those who have operated off-grid, but it represents a maturation of the industry within Russia. It could lead to a more professionalized and transparent mining sector. Broader Implications: What Does This Mean for Global Crypto? Russia‚Äôs move is not isolated. It‚Äôs part of a global trend where governments are increasingly grappling with how to regulate cryptocurrencies. Countries like the United States, Canada, and various European nations are also exploring or implementing their own regulatory frameworks for digital assets. Russia‚Äôs approach, particularly its focus on a national equipment registry, could serve as a blueprint or a cautionary tale for other nations considering similar measures. It highlights a growing recognition that crypto mining, as a significant energy consumer and economic activity, cannot remain entirely unregulated. This trend suggests that: Regulation is Inevitable: More countries will likely follow suit, introducing various forms of oversight.
